description: so with recent version, advertising started to pop up, now still only in apps section of administator options, but more will surely come and thats just great!
Desktop sync to your Nextcloud instance.
summary: Great app for the successor to owncloud

description: The desktop client is more convenient than the browser for daily usage. Great!
I like that it simply works.
Nextcloud works really well and the Linux client is solid.
summary: Great client for a great self-hosted cloud

description: Hi! This cool software!
Works really well!
It's great and handles all of the work that I need.
Simply crashes or doesn't sync correctly. Been broken for going on 6 months now. Revert to the previous version before 2.5.1

I'm running an older version of NextCloud (14) since I have it running on Debian Stable and I decided not to mess with the stock version of PHP. 

The client works flawlessly. It's been missing from debian for quite some time, so I wanted to give a huge thank you to the maintainers for creating this package.
summary: Works perfectly, even with older versions of Nextcloud Server

description: Works well, looks nice. Easy to set up free hosting with a provider (3G, with mine), and really cheap to expand - 2$/year to expand it to 50G!

On fedora 30 you have to manually install "libgnome-keyring" to fix the always logged out state after each reboot. furthermore there is no status icon in the top panel which would prevent the sync client view from popping up as well on every log in... so it's a mixed feelings situation here right now.
summary: Good app, but missing status icon in panel on fedora30

description: Was unable to get past the Connect > Next step on install from the package store. The version packaged within the store seems to be one version behind.

Currently it does the basic jobs you would expect, and does them well. 
Setting up your own server is very easy.
It's been a great project to follow, and I have no doubt it will continue to improve.
Simply doesn't work. Can't get past the setup. Crashes and closes.
I just synced 2gb of files from my cloud server. I've been using Nextcloud for about 2 years and haven't had any problems. Keep up the good work.
This client has never let me down. I rarely visit my server through the browser.
summary: Excellent client for my Nextcloud Server Snap Package

description: I love using this so that I'm not being screwed over by google

This app is pretty good!
Mostly I do only use this app and do not visit the website at all.
It is possible to share also in combination with an fileExplorerplugin (which I can recommend also) 
Sadly sometimes I had problems with the synchronisation - keep this in mind

To all the fellow developers: GREAT WORK! 
Keep it going

Perfect! 
I also love the option of the monochrome icon.
Works as expected with several nextcloud instances on Ubuntu 19.10 in combination with gnome-online-accounts.
Doesn't function at all even after ending task, uninstalling, reinstalling.
works incredibly fine even with large amounts of data (10'000+ files) and over multiple computers, locations, users and OS (windows and linux). never had an issue so far.

This version of the client does not work with a IPv6 primary connection in a dual stack setup. Turn off IPv6 and the client connects. Leave IPv6 on and the client times-out. The latest official Nextcloud client works.
summary: Needs Updated - Does not work with IPV6

description: Updates so quickly -sometimes while my file is still open. Makes it very easy to add files such as Xfce Notes (sticky note pad), too. Provides a nice round bright icon in panel to show that files are or are not synced.
I am able to install the desktop client, but unable to maintain a connection to the Nextcloud server. Keeps disconnecting. Not sure why.
summary: Installs but will not sync - keeps disconnecting

description: Simple. Reliable. Unobtrusive in use. An excellent product from next cloud.
summary: Simply excellent. Does what it says on the tin

description:
I've been using this to take notes for a long time. I sync over a local nextcloud instance on my network. It's perfect for letting me pickup any computer in the house to jot something down or look something up.

The maintainer is friendly and open to ideas and pull requests :-)
summary: Been Using For a Long TIme Love It!

description: It doesent start on Ubuntu 20.10
since the last update the nextcloud client hangs and ubuntu asks if I want keep waiting or terminiate the client.
summary: does not start since last update

description:
It has been working flawless until recently. It is a pity cause the old version and the way to show activity is nicer than the new app and its notification system that I dislike. 

All in all, what can I say? it is a wonderful cloud solution, it just stopped working a couple of months a ago, but that is no problem at all, cause there are beautiful appimages that work great in Kubuntu.
summary: The old version better than the new one

description: does, what it's supposed to

I use this release of the Nextcloud desktop client on a daily basis on two Ubuntu installations and it seems to works about as well as the Windows client, which I have also installed on two Windows 10 installations. 
Both clients seem to sync ignored files anyways though
summary: Works about as well as the Windows client

description: Nextcloud is a great app and this flatpak just works out of the box
The fork by the original ownCloud author, Nextcloud iterates and surpasses its predecessor. Nextcloud lets you take back control of you data. This flatpak client works flawlessly!
Works as good as the native Client. I use it on Arch with Gnome. Flatpack is way easier than using the AUR Package.
Using Nextcloud for everything. Better than any proprietary offering.

I using nextcloud for personal notes and documents that I then sync to my linux laptop and android phone.
Works great. One thing I dont like is non being able to run in the background in gnome DE.
Leider ist der Server Part manchmal etwas in performant aber ansonsten.
Problemlos und stabil mit meinem eigenen Server.
Nextcloud die wichtigste Application. Ohne der geht garnix. Und es funktioniert wunderbar. Vielen Dank an das Team.
summary: Super wichtig und schnurrt wie ein Kätzchen

description: Läuft stabil. Unverzichtbar.

Lief schon unter Ubuntu nicht ganz rund. Stürzte mitunter beim Programstart ab. Autostart wurde nicht immer zuverlässig ausgeführt. Koto Einstellungen wurden nicht zuverlässig übernommen. Nun, unter pureOS-debian 9 startet der Client, es zeigt sich aber keine GIU. Ist also nicht verwendbar. Schade, es wäre mir wichtig.
Die Verbindung zu einem Nextcloud-Server ist nicht möglich. In früheren Versionen gab es keine Probleme.
Macht was es soll und das schon seit Jahren.
Installieren, verbinden, glücklich sein. Seit Monaten zuverlässig...
Ständig Sync Fehler
Das Ding funktioniert einfach zuverlässig
Lieber das PPA der Entwickler benutzen. Deutlich (!) aktueller.
Einige Server lassen nur noch Versionen > 3 zu, damit funktioniert diese Version (aktuell hier 2.6) nicht mehr.
Installation nicht möglich
Funktioniert problemlos!

So ein unmöglicher Mist.
Stürzt ständig ab. 
Leider muss ich einen Stern vergeben Null wären passender.
I'm unable to choose a sync folder. It simply wont popup the filechooser. So this client is useless for now (2017.12.29)
does not autostart under gnome, no gnome icon
Funciona perfectamente, yo la recomiendo al 100%
Funciona bien en Oracle-Linux 7x
Aplicación muy útil, funciona sin problemas de ningún tipo
No abre. No puedo correrla.

La aplicación la puntuara aún mejor, de no ser porque nunca se ha corregido un error que hace mostrar de forma erronea la cantidad de almacenamiento ocupado por las carpetas. Por ejemplo: yo tengo en mi servicio en la nube 8GB de almacenamiento, pero a la hora de darme el dato de cuanto he consumido de esos 8GB me muestra 500GB de 8GB (cuando solo he consumido 500MB), lo cual puede resultar un poco molesto.
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

Nextcloud est un excellent moyen de se passer des services drives propriétaires et, cerise sur le gâteau, l'application de synchronisation est disponible sous GNU-Linux. 
Elle gère globalement bien les transferts même si les erreurs de synchronisation peuvent être parfois nombreuses. On aurait peut-être apprécié des messages d'erreurs moins hermétiques qui facilitent le travail d'inverstigation.
C'est en tout cas un must have !

Après installation, lancement de l'application
Je renseigne le serveur, l'application indique "cliquez ici pour vous connecter", ce que je fais puis plus rien, la fenêtre se ferme et rien ne se passe.
Je suis très déçu... d'autant plus que je n'ai pas davantage de succès avec l'application téléchargée depuis le site de nextcloud. Ne me dîtes pas que je dois retourner sous windows !!
L'application est très simple à utiliser. Seul bémol, un fort ralentissement du pc lors des synchronisations.
Marche très bien sur Fedora 30. Le choix des dossiers à synchroniser et les débits de synchronisation sont très intéressants.
L'app est bien, mais pas à jour !!
La connexion reste bloquée à l'étape "Accès au compte" dans le navigateur : après avoir cliqué sur le bouton "Autoriser l'accès", ça tourne en boucle, sans aller plus loin : (

Malheureusement, le paquet flatpak fait correspondre un dossier accueil (home) qui pointe vers un pseudo arborescence.

C'est dommage, car la version incluse dans ma distribution fonctionne très bien.
Все работает как надо! Синхронизирую со своим домашним сервером, все отлично
Просто и удобно, есть интеграция с некоторыми файловыми менеджерами.
С какого-то перепуга ломится в wine каджую секунду. Вешает систему. Пришлось убить процесс!
